text: Backlash (2000) was a professional wrestling pay-per-view show made by the World Wrestling Federation (WWF). It took place on April 30, 2000 at the MCI Center in Washington, D.C.. It was the second Backlash event held by the WWF. ==Matches== No. Rsults Stipulations Times 1 D'Lo Brown defeated Al Snow by disqualification Singles match N/A 2 Steve Blackman defeated Val Venis 3 The Godfather and Kaientai (Taka Michinoku and Funaki) defeated Steven Richards and The Headbangers (Mosh and Thrasher) Six-man Tag team match 4 Edge and Christian (c) defeated D-Generation X (X-Pac and The Road Dogg) (with Tori) Tag team match for the WWF Tag Team Championship 8:37 5 Dean Malenko (c) defeated Scotty 2 Hotty Singles match for the WWF Light Heavyweight Championship 11:47 6 The Big Boss Man and Bull Buchanan defeated The Acolytes (Faarooq and Bradshaw Tag team match 8:37 7 Crash Holly (c) defeated Matt Hardy, Jeff Hardy, Hardcore Holly, Perry Saturn, and Tazz Six-pack Hardcore match for the WWF Hardcore Championship 12:16 8 The Big Show defeated Kurt Angle Singles match 2:35 9 T & A (Test and Albert) (with Trish Stratus) defeated The Dudley Boyz (Bubba Ray and D-Von) Tag team match 11:06 10 Eddie Guerrero (c) (with Chyna) defeated Essa Rios (with Lita) Singles match for the WWF European Championship 8:38 11 Chris Benoit (c) defeated Chris Jericho by disqualification Singles match for the WWF Intercontinental Championship 15:03 12 The Rock defeated Triple H (c) (with Mr. McMahon and Stephanie McMahon- Helmsley) Singles match for the WWF Championship with Shane McMahon as the special guest referee 19:22 ==References== ==Other websites== *Official Backlash 2000 website Category:2000 in professional wrestling Category:Sports in Washington, D.C. title: Backlash (2000)
